alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 7:31PM EDT until July 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large of thunderstorms with torrential rain impacting areas from Hardeeville and Pritchardville. Radar and automated rain gage reports show as much as 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen in this area today with a few spots reporting over 4 inches. The risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas continues, even as rain rates diminish as storms exit the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluffton, Hardeeville, Pritchardville, Levy, Limehouse, Palmetto Bluff and Myrtle Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
